DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate steady state pharmacokinetics ( PK ) bictegravir ( GS-9883 ) confirm dose bictegravir/emtricitabine/tenofovir alafenamide ( B/F/TAF ) fixed-dose combination ( FDC ) HIV-1 infect , virologically suppress adolescent ( 12 < 18 year age ) child ( 6 < 12 year age ) . This study also evaluate safety tolerability B/F/TAF FDC Week 24 HIV-1 infect , virologically suppress adolescent child .
DOC.brief_title: B/F/TAF FDC HIV-1 Infected Virologically Suppressed Adolescents Children
DOC.criteria: Key HIV1 infect adolescent child virologically suppress ≥ 6 month stable regimen Cohort 1 : 12 < 18 year old weight screen ≥ 35 kg ( 77 lb ) Cohort 2 : 6 < 12 year old weight screen ≥ 25 kg ( 55 lb ) Documented plasma HIV1 RNA < 50 copies/mL stable regimen ( undetectable HIV1 RNA level accord local assay use limit detection ≥ 50 copies/mL ) ≥ 6 month precede Screening visit . Unconfirmed virologic elevation ≥ 50 copies/mL ( transient detectable viremia , `` blip '' ) prior screen acceptable . If low limit detection local HIV1 RNA assay < 50 copies/mL ( eg , < 20 copies/mL ) , plasma HIV1 RNA level exceed 50 copies/mL two consecutive HIV1 RNA test . Stable antiretroviral regimen 2 nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor ( NRTIs ) combination third agent minimum 6 month prior screen visit . Individuals undergo dose modification antiretroviral regimen growth switch medication formulation ( ) consider stable antiretroviral regimen . Estimated glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) ≥ 90 mL/min/1.73 m^2 accord Schwartz Formula No document suspect resistance emtricitabine ( FTC ) , tenofovir ( TFV ) , integrase strand transfer inhibitor ( INSTIs ) include , limited , reverse transcriptase resistance mutation K65R M184V/I Note : Other protocol define Inclusion/Exclusion criterion may apply .
